TopicTitle: Liquid fuel to oxidiser ratio has changed?

Articles.Content:
I have craft that I launched before KSP 1.0 and I'm now finding that the liquid fuel and oxidiser which used to decrease in unison are now decreasing at different rates, leaving me with an excess of oxidiser in my craft. Do the tanks I put on new craft now have different ratios of both?

If they changed the engines on already launched craft, I don't see why they couldn't have changed the tanks/fuel/oxidiser as well so that this doesn't happen.

Edited April 28, 2015 by THX1138
Do you have any LV-N's? They only use LF now, no O.

Oh right. I use them every chance I get. That seems like tanks will now be wasting space with an empty oxidiser compartment on launch. The oxidiser in existing craft is also going to weigh them down until I can dock them to something to drain it out.
There's the spaceplane tanks, a little unconventional I know but it's pure sweet LF
You can also use the modular fuel tanks mod change the tanks to pure LF (once the mod updates anyway).
